alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Kimball, southwestern Banner and southeastern Laramie Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 714 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Gun Barrel to near Burns to 9 miles west of Carpenter. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Burns, Albin, Oliver Campground, Hillsdale, Oliver Reservoir, Panorama Point, Carpenter and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 379 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
